skill.name: url-analysis
skill.description: URL validation and contextual analysis specialist. Use when validating links, analyzing URL context, extracting links from content, or ensuring link appropriateness. Combines technical validation with content analysis.
skill.summary: URL validation and contextual analysis specialist. Use when validating links, analyzing URL context,...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This skill is a legitimate URL validation tool. It makes HTTP requests to validate URLs and reads files to extract links, which is necessary for its stated purpose. Code is clean and well-structured with no malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Broken links and misaligned references damage user trust and content quality. This skill automatically validates URLs, checks HTTP status codes, follows redirects, and evaluates link relevance to ensure all references point to appropriate, accessible destinations.
actual_capabilities: Validates URL accessibility using HTTP HEAD requests
Checks HTTP status codes and redirect chains
Extracts all URLs from documents and files
Identifies broken, redirected, and slow links
Analyzes link text against destination content
Provides JSON output with validation results
limitations: Does not perform deep content verification beyond HTTP checks
Does not bypass rate limiting or access restrictions
Does not modify files or fix links automatically

use_cases.title: Validate documentation links
use_cases.description: Check all links in documentation for broken references and redirect chains before publishing

use_cases.title: Audit blog post links
use_cases.description: Verify external links in articles point to relevant, authoritative, and accessible sources

use_cases.title: Quality assurance checks
use_cases.description: Identify redirect chains and broken external links that impact search engine rankings

prompt_templates.title: Validate document links
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate all URLs in this document and report their status codes, redirect chains, and any broken links

prompt_templates.title: Check specific URL
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if this URL is accessible: [URL]. Report the HTTP status, response time, and any redirects

prompt_templates.title: Analyze link relevance
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all links from this content and evaluate whether each link text accurately describes its destination

prompt_templates.title: Full link audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete link audit: extract all URLs, validate each one technically, check redirect chains, and assess contextual relevance

output_examples.input: Validate all URLs in this document

best_practices: Validate links in staging environments before publishing content
Update URLs that redirect to their final destination to improve performance
Check that link text accurately describes where the link leads
Use HTTPS URLs and verify SSL certificates are valid
anti_patterns: Ignoring 404 errors without investigating the cause
Leaving redirect chains unresolved in documentation
Linking to pages that require login without providing alternative public references
Using link shorteners that hide the destination URL

faq.question: What URL validation methods does this skill use?
faq.answer: It uses HTTP HEAD requests to check URL accessibility without downloading full content, following redirects automatically.

faq.question: How many URLs can it validate at once?
faq.answer: There is no hard limit, but validation is sequential. Large batches may take significant time to process.

faq.question: Can it integrate with CI/CD pipelines?
faq.answer: The Python helper script can be called from command line or scripts, making it suitable for automated workflows.

faq.question: Is any data sent to external services?
faq.answer: The skill only makes requests to the URLs being validated. No user data is sent to third-party services.

faq.question: What causes false negatives in validation?
faq.answer: Firewalls, rate limiting, authentication requirements, and temporarily unreachable servers can cause false negatives.

faq.question: How does this compare to browser-based link checkers?
faq.answer: This skill runs in your environment with full control over validation logic, while browser tools may have different network access and caching behaviors.
